definitions.definition: A historically constituted, stable community of people, formed on the basis of a common language, territory, economic life, ethnicity and/or psychological make-up manifested in a common culture.
definitions.example: The Kurdish people constitute a nation in the Middle East
Though legally single nations, many states comprise several distinct cultural or ethnic groups.

definitions.definition: An association of students based on its members' birthplace or ethnicity.
definitions.example: Once widespread across Europe in medieval times, nations are now largely restricted to the ancient universities of Sweden and Finland.

definitions.definition: A great number; a great deal.
